thread.section_title: Stock Market & Finance News - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Carlyle Profit Tops Expectations as Its Portfolio Value Climbs

author: Miriam Gottfried
title: Carlyle Profit Tops Expectations as Its Portfolio Value Climbs
text:
Carlyle beats profit expectations as fundraising gains momentum But a drop in performance revenues meant earnings sagged versus the prior year By Miriam Gottfried 1:38 p.m. GMT
Carlyle Group reported a first-quarter profit that exceeded Wall Street’s expectations as its fundraising machine barreled forward. Still, a drop in performance revenues meant earnings sagged versus the prior year.
Economic net income, a closely watched performance measure that reflects changes in the value of the firm’s holdings, fell to $161m on a post-tax basis, or 47 cents a share, from $364.6m, or $1.09 a share, a year earlier. Analysts polled by FactSet had expected 29 cents. ... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In Filter by Topic
